Actions.Tooltip:
New Item (Ctrl+N)

Create a new item.

New Items

Create a new item, such as a new Meeting or Contact.

Ignore Conversation (Ctrl+Del)

Move current and future messages in the selected conversation to the Deleted Items folder.

Clean Up

Remove redundant messages in the selected conversation.

Junk

Mark the selected items as junk or prevent items sent by this sender, this sender's domain, or this group or mailing list from being marked as junk.

MenuItems.Label: Never Block this Group or Mailing List

Actions.Tooltip:
Delete (Ctrl+D)

Delete this item.

Reply (Ctrl+R)

Reply to the sender of this message.

Reply All (Ctrl+Shift+R)

Reply to the sender and all other recipients of this message.

Forward (Ctrl+F)

Forward this item to someone else.

Reply with Meeting (Ctrl+Alt+R)

Create a meeting request from this email.

IM

Reply to this message with an instant item.

More Respond Actions

Use other response actions that can include forwarding this item as an attachment or text message (SMS) or calling the sender of this item.

Move

Move or copy the selected items to another folder.

For e-mail messages, you can create a rule to always move messages in the selected conversation to another folder.

MenuItems.Label: Always Move Messages in This Conversation...

Actions.Tooltip:
Rules

Create a rule based on the sender, recipients or conversation topic of this message to always move mail to a different folder.

Assign Policy

Assign an archive or retention policy to automatticly archive or delete the selected items.

Unread/ Read (Ctrl+U/Ctrl+Q)

Mark this item as read or unread.

Categorize

Categorize this item.

Categories applied to a conversation will be applied to all current and future items in the conversation.

Follow Up

Set a flag to remind you to follow up this item later. Flagged items appear in the To-Do Bar, Daily Task List and Tasks.

Address Book (Ctrl+Shift+B)

Open the Address Book to look for names, phone numbers and e-mail addresses

Filter Email

Filter email messages to only show certain items such as unread or flagged items.

MenuItems.Label: Sent To: Me or CC: Me

Actions.Tooltip:
Send/Receive All Folders (F9)

Send and receive items such as mail messages, calendar appointments and tasks in all folders.

Update Folder (Shift+F9)

Send and receive items in this folder.

Send All

Sent all unset mail.

Send/Receive Groups

Send and receive items in a particular send/receive group.

Send/Receive groups can have different behaviors such at the frequence with which Oulook connects to the server.

Show Progress

Shows the current send/receive status.

Cancel All

Cancel all pending send/receive requests.

Download Headers

Download all mail headers in this folder.

A mail header contains some message fields such as the e-mail address of the sender, subject and date.

Mark to Download(Ctrl+Alt+M)

Mark this message to be downloaded the next time marked headers are processed.

Unmark to Download(Ctrl+Alt+U)

Unmark this message header so that it is not downloaded.

Process Marked Headers

Download the content of all marked headers in this folder.

MenuItems.Label: Process Marked Headers In All Folders

Actions.Tooltip:
Download Preferences

Change the preferences for downloading message headers.

MenuItems.Label: Download Headers and Then Full Items
On Slow Connection Download Only Headers

Actions.Tooltip:
Work Offline

Work offline if you do not want to receive new mail.

Work Folder (Ctrl+Shift+E)

Create a new folder in the navigation pane.

New Search Folder (Ctrl+Shift+P)

Create a new search folder.

A search folder displays messages based on specified criteria. Some example search folders include all messages flagged for follow up and unread mail.

Rename This Folder

Rename the selected folder.

Copy This Folder

Copy this folder to a new location.

Move This Folder

Move the selected folder to a new location.

Delete This Folder

Delete the selected folder.

Mark All as Read

Mark all messages in this folder as read.

Run Rules Now

Apply all rules to the items currently in your mailbox.

Show all Folders A to Z

Always shows folders in alphabetical order.

Clean Up Folder

Remove redundant messages from every conversation in the selected folder.

Delete All

Delete all of the items in this folder.

Recover Deleted Items

Recover items deleted from this folder.

Show in Favorites

Show this folder in the Favorites section at the top of the Folder Pane.

AutoArchive Settings

Specify when items in this folder are archived, and where they are stored.

Share

View and edit the sharing permissions for this folder.

Folder Properties

View the properties for this folder.

Change View

Change the current view to another view.

MenuItem.Label: Save Current View As a New View...
Apply Current View to Other Mail Folders...

Actions.Tooltip:
View Settings

Customize the current view using advanced view settings.

Advanced view settings include adding and removing fields, grouping, sorting, filtering, column formatting and other settings.

Reset View

Reset all current view settings to the default settings for this folder.

Show as Conversations

Show messages arranged by conversation.

Conversation Options

Change the way conversations are displayed in the message list.

Message Preview

Use AutoPreview to quickly scan items.

Reverse Sort

Reverse the sort order of the current view.

For example, reverse the sort order of the message list from newest to oldest.

Add Columns

Choose which fields are showed in the view.

Expand/Collapse

Expand or collapse groups in the list.

Folder Pane

Show, Hide, or minimize the Folder Pane and show or hide Favorites.

Reading Properties

Show, Hide, or change the layout Reading Pane.

To-Do Bar

Show, Hide, or minimize the To-Do Bar and choose what is shown.

People Pane

Show, Hide, or minimize the People Pane and configure social network accounts.

Reminders Window

Show the reminders window.

Open in New Window

Opens this folder is a new window.

Folder Properties

Close all additional windows.

Change Style

Change the style of the application

Change Theme

Change the theme of the application

Edit Shape

Change the shape of this drawing, convert it it a freeform shape, or edit the wrap points to determine how text wraps around the drawing.

Draw Text Box

Draw a text box anywhere in your document.

Shape Fill

Fill the selected shape with a solid color, gradient, picture, or texture.

Shape Outline

Pick the color, width, and line style for the outline of your shape.

Shape Effects

Apply a visual effect to the selected shape such as shadow, glow, reflection or 3-D rotation.

Text Fill

Fill the text with a solid color, gradient, picture, or texture.

Text Outline

Customize the outline of your text by choosing the color, width, and line style.

Text Effects

Turn your work into a work of art.

Add a visual effect such as shadow, glow or reflection to your text.

Text Direction

Change the orientation of the text to vertical, stacked or rotate it to the desired direction.

Align Text

Change how your text is aligned within the text box.

Create Link

Let your text flow from one textbox to another.

Click an empty text box to link it to the current one.

Position

Choose where the selected object will appear on the page.

Text will automatically wrap around the object so that it's still easy to read.

Wrap Text

Choose how your text wraps around the selected object.

For example you can choose to have the text continue around the object or cross right over it.

Bring Forward

Bring the selected object forward one level, or bring it front of all the other objects.

Send Backward

Send the selected object back one level, or send it behind all the other objects.

Selection Pane

See a list of all your objects.

This makes it easier to select objects, change their order, or change their visibility.

Align Objects

Change the placement of your selected objects on the page.

This is great for aligning objects to the margins of the edge of the page. You can also align them relative to one another.

Group Objects

Join objects together to move and format them as if they were a single object.

Rotate Objects

Rotate or flip the selected object.

Shape Height

Change the height of the shape or picture.

Shape Width

Change the width of the shape or picture.

Header Row

Display special formatting for the first row of the table.

Total Row

Display special formatting for the last row of the table.

Banded Rows

Display banded rows, in which even rows are formatted differently from odd rows.

This banding can make tables easier to read.

First Column

Display special formatting for the first column of the table.

Last Column

Display special formatting for the last column of the table.

Banded Columns

Display banded columns, in which even columns are formatted differently from odd columns.

This banding can make tables easier to read.
